strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_low>*: This here's Arcadia. The whole place is full of stonemasons and their workshops. Look around and you'll see.
<se_def>*: There was such a racket going on, I came out to see what was happening. I'm sure I can hear screaming.
<se_def>*: The place is normally so quiet. I wonder what's going on.
<se_def>*: I saw her do it! The same girl who broke through the southern checkpoint came here!
<se_def>*: Well, she won't get away from me! She injured a load of people back there. Where's she got to?
<se_high>*: What's going on!? I'm scared! ♪
<se_def>*: Unless I'm very much mistaken, that was one of Dominico's guards. I recognise the voice.
<se_def>*: Which means...whatever's going on is happening just upstairs! Dominico lives in that big house with the fence around it above here, you see.
<se_high>*: I heard a man shouting, so I came running to see what it was! I still don't know what's going on, though.
<se_def>*: A woman just went up those steps there. I've not seen her 'round these parts before.<page>*: But she can't be the thug who's been causin' all the trouble...can she!?
<se_def>*: No, no. That's not right. You can't call a lady a thug now, can you?
<se_def>*: How should I put it, then? A thugess? A ruffianette? A hoodlumina?
<se_def>*: I can't be doin' with this place! These bleedin' artisans are all the same. Boring! It's like watchin' paint dry around here!
<se_high>*: Everyone's making such a noise! How is one supposed to concentrate on the stonework!?
<se_high>*: Not a moment ago, I heard screams coming from Dominico's mansion!
<se_high>*: Oh, dear Goddess! Protect your loyal servants in Arcadia from tragedy!
<se_def>*: Grrrrrr.
<se_high>*: Oh, dear Goddess! It's terrible! That poor man lying injured over there in Dominico's courtyard!
<se_low>*: She must have been some woman to go and floor one of Dominico's guards! It gives me the shivers just thinking about it!
<se_high>*: You've got to help! A woman just attacked one of Dominico's guards and broke into the mansion!
<se_high>*: If anything happens to him, the whole town will be finished!
<se_def>*: Urgh... She...caught me off guard!
<se_def>*: I...don't know who you are...but, please! Protect...the Master!
<se_low>*: It sounds like there's quite a commotion outside.<page>*: Even in times of trouble, the Goddess teaches us to calm our hearts and listen to Her voice speaking to us.
<se_def>*: Sh-She... She paralysed me...with a single spell!
<se_def>*: David's upstairs, but he won't stand a chance against that girl alone. Please! Help him fight her off!
<se_high>*: I'm sorry! I'm so sorry! Oh! Muuuuuum!!!
<se_high>*: W-Who are you!? If you're after money, you won't find anything of value in here!
<se_def>*: Oh, dear me! I-I'm just a poor cook. Please don't hurt me!
<se_def>*: David told me that the Master is all right. That's good news. Still, that<endash>
<se_def>*: Aaargh! Oooh, it still hurts where that girl got me.
<se_high>*: It was a bit touch and go there for a while. But David told me that terrifying lady's gone now.
<se_high>*: Still, it goes to show you, doesn't it?<page>*: If you become as famous and important as Master Dominico, there'll be people out to get you! It's scary.
<se_def>*: At least the Master is alive.<page>*: But if I'd only done what I'm paid to do, he wouldn't have been in danger in the first place. A fine guard I am...
<se_def>*: I'm bound to lose my job now. Master Dominico isn't exactly forgiving at the best of times.
<se_high>*: It must be more than six months now since David came to the house.
<se_high>*: My first impressions were of a grubby little traveller, but he's actually very attentive and good-natured. He's a nice lad, you know.
<se_high>*: I really can't see why Dominico has such a problem with him. And why on earth would you employ someone you dislike so much anyway!?
<se_def>*: They're saying the woman who attacked Master Dominico got away, aren't they?
<se_def>*: So she might come back again, then? Oh, heaven forbid!
<se_high>*: As soon as David came out and told everyone that the attacker had run away, everyone disappeared.<page>*: Like someone had pulled the plug in a bath!
<se_high>*: They didn't really care what was happening! They all just wanted to join in with the shouting and screaming!
<se_high>*: I heard something exciting was happening, but it's finished already!
<se_low>*: This town is built on an arch of rock that joins two continents, you know.
<se_low>*: Why did people decide to settle here? Well, you've got me there! I really couldn't tell you.
<se_low>*: I was given instructions by a certain wealthy gentleman to come here and purchase a statue of a woman on his behalf.
<se_low>*: But there are so many workshops in this place, I don't know where to start!
<se_def>*: Nobody breaks through the checkpoint while I'm on duty!<page>*: I'll teach that girl a lesson! Although...I seem to have lost her for the time being.
<se_def>*: But I can't go back now. It'd be too annoying, having come all this way. I may as well have a look at the sights while I'm here.
<se_high>*: Masonry is the art of creating the Goddess's image in rock. All the people of Arcadia are Her obedient servants.
<se_high>*: The fact that no lives were lost in the disturbance we had before just goes to show that the town is under the Goddess's divine protection.
<se_def>*: A lot of people come here to study masonry. And everyone has their different aspirations.
<se_def>*: Some are aiming to be world-famous sculptors working at a castle, and others just enjoy carving bits of rock.
<se_def>*: All these different people's hopes and dreams have combined over the years to shape the Arcadia you see today.<page>*: It's sort of like they've sculpted it, I suppose!
<se_low>*: I used to be a rather important minister in a certain kingdom which shall remain anonymous.<page>*: But I decided I'd like to become a stoneworker when I retired.
<se_low>*: I'm hard at it everyday now. You've got to keep chip, chipping away! Ah ha ha!
<se_def>*: Some stonemasons toss their failed works into the ocean, but I like to keep mine.
<se_def>*: I find it helps me to improve what I'm doing if I have some failures to look at while I'm working.<page>*: I suppose it's rather like a warning not to make the same mistake twice.
<se_high>*: Have you heard? Apparently the burglar who broke into Dominico's place was a woman!
<se_high>*: It just goes to show how bad the economy is! I mean, if women are turning to burglary now... Whatever will it be next!?
<se_low>*: I studied masonry here when I was a lad, and I went on to become the chief stonemason of an entire kingdom!
<se_low>*: But I decided to pack that job in a couple of years ago now. I came back here so I could help the new generation of young masons.
<se_low>*: I could tell you a story, if you like. It's a bit long, but do you want to hear it anyway?
<se_low>*: Right then! Here goes...
<se_low>*: I was heralded as a genius with the hammer and chisel when I was a lad.<page>*: But there was one boy among my peers who I just couldn't compete with.
<se_low>*: He was a chap called Rydon. One of the Kranbartle family. Of course, he's just an old fogey like me now.
<se_low>*: Every generation of the Kranbartle family seems to give rise to another gifted stonemason. And in Rydon they had one of the very best.

<se_low>*: But he was haunted by the family legacy from the first moment he picked up a chisel.<page>*: He was always worrying that he wouldn't live up to the illustrious reputation of his master stonemason forefathers.
<se_low>*: According to a story I was told, the person in charge of sculpting the Goddess statue on the Holy Isle of Neos was a Kranbartle as well.
<se_low>*: Rydon's still carving rock now, trying to outdo ancestors who've done great things like that!
<se_low>*: And that's my story. Looks like old Rydon bettered me in terms of skill AND determination, eh!?
<se_low>*: Oh? Well, I suppose a story about the Kranbartle family wouldn't be of much interest to you if masonry doesn't tickle your fancy.
<se_def>*: We take the finished statues to Dominico so that he can enchant 'em with a soul, see. He's a great magician.
<se_def>*: ...Why? I dunno! Because! It's a sort of tradition, I s'pose.
<se_def>*: Have you seen that big black dog Dominico's got? Leopold, he's called. No, my mistake! SIR Leopold! It's a creepy mutt if you ask me.
<se_def>*: And vicious to go with it! I'm tellin' you, there's somethin' wrong with Dominico's head if he thinks that thing's cute!
<se_def>*: Hm? Yes, this is the Kranbartle household. Who are you?
<se_def>*: You're looking for the Kran Spinels? You'll have to talk to my father about them, I'm afraid. But he's not here.
<se_def>*: He's building a tower off to the east of town. You'll need this if you want to get in there to see him.
<Cap><leader> receives a stone sword and puts it in the bag.
<se_def>*: Put that sword into the keyhole of the tower door, and it should open up.
<se_def>*: My father's name is Rydon. If you do go and manage to speak to him, perhaps you could ask him to come and visit his family once in a while!?

<se_def>*: If you want to know about the Kran Spinel jewels, you'll have to ask my father.<page>*: He's in that tower I told you about, off to the east of town. I don't know anything about them, I'm afraid.
<se_def>*: Like I said, his name's Rydon.<page>*: And remember to pass on my message, if you do manage to find him. Tell him to come home and visit his family once in a while!
<se_high>*: D'you want to know what I'm doing? I'm chewing on Mum's recipes!
<se_high>*: Grandpa always told me I should sit and chew on things for a while if I didn't understand them. So I'm chewing on these.
<se_high>*: The Kranbartle family is full of talented masons. Unfortunately, my husband isn't one of them!
<se_high>*: It upset him quite a lot when he was younger, but he's got over it now and manages to enjoy the other things in his life.
<se_def>*: Well! You're a bit keen, aren't you!? Drinking's an evening affair. Come back once the sun's set!
<se_high>*: A good waitress always smiles! And I'm very hard-working, you know. You have to be if you want to be the best little bunny in the world!
<se_high>*: It ain't<endash> Ahem! It isn't just men who make good stonemasons, you know! Women are perfectly capable of it too.
<se_high>*: Anyway, I don't have time for idle chit-chat! If you've nuffin'<endash> ...nothing to say, kindly leave me in peace!
<se_def>*: This is just between you and me, but that big black dog of Dominico's bit me the other day.
<se_def>*: His master came running over to apologise. Or so I thought! What he actually said was: ‘Don't give Sir Leopold germs!’
<se_def>*: He might be a great magician, but that man has the manners of a dog himself!
<se_high>*: Dominico's always telling everyone that he's the heir of a great sage or something, but I don't know what he's talking about.
<se_high>*: The truth is that no one in town wants anything to do with the stuck-up old fuddy-duddy. But no one would ever say that, of course.
<se_high>*: There are more than a handful of people who were disappointed to hear Dominico went unscathed in that burglary the other day.
<se_high>*: We all bow and scrape whenever he's around, but inside most people around here detest the man.
<se_low>*: If you follow the path outside Dominico's house straight up north, there's a shop they call ‘Mystery Mart’.
<se_low>*: I don't know what they sell, but a fishy-looking man comes and opens it up of a night.
<se_def>*: Huh huh. That was a good shop! This town's got some remarkable goods for sale!
<se_low>*: They say old grandpa Kranbartle's still buildin' that tower of his all on his own. Rydon, his name is.
<se_low>*: Eccentric doesn't even cut it with him! But I wouldn't mind a bit of his get-up-and-go!
<se_low>*: The old girl spends all day every day looking out to sea. She said something about a ship sailing under the archway a while ago.
<se_low>*: It's good to hear there are still people sailing the high seas.
<se_high>*: Apparently we've a new young hopeful in town. He's entered the workshop just above us as an apprentice, I hear.
<se_low>*: You idiot! I told you the legs were wobbly! Now hold the ladder!
<se_low>Dominico: I don't know who YOU are, but I imagine you know who I am! You've heard of the Great Magician Dominico, I presume!?
<se_low>Dominico: What an honour to have helped me! How lucky you are!
<se_low>Dominico: I will permit you to dispense with formalities and simply call me ‘Master Dominico’.
<se_low>Dominico: Now then, that wand-waving sprat... She said something rather ominous about coming back, did she not?

<se_low>Dominico: Well even the Great Dominico cannot magic up a barrier stronger than the one I had already erected.<page>Dominico: So despite having thanked you already for helping me before, I shall now bestow you with the honour of running a little errand for me!
<se_low>Dominico: You accept, no doubt?
<se_low>Dominico: Ah ha ha! There's no need to be shy.<page>Dominico: And just think how all your friends will envy you when they hear you have been given a task by the Great Dominico!
<se_low>Dominico: Well? No doubt you've changed your mind, and you will now accept the task?
<se_low>Dominico: Good. Now then, there has long been a family of stonemasons in this town called the Kranbartles.
<se_low>Dominico: There are two jewels, known as the Kran Spinels, which have been in that family for generations.<page>Dominico: The jewels harbour tremendous magical power.
<se_low>Dominico: I've asked them to give me the gemstones before, but the last Kranbartle was a stubborn old fool. He refused to listen to reason!
<se_low>Dominico: So your task is simply to persuade the Kranbartle family to hand over the Kran Spinels.
<se_low>Dominico: However stubborn they are, I'm sure they wouldn't ignore a truly heartfelt plea.<page>Dominico: Anyway, the method you use is up to you. I only care about results!
<se_low>Dominico: I will be unable to construct a barrier capable of warding off that pesky wand-waving wench without those jewels, so hurry along!
<se_low>Dominico: Oh, you foolishly forgot to ask me! The Kranbartles live in a tiny little place situated just below the fountain in the courtyard.
<se_low>Dominico: I need you to get me the Kran Spinels. The Kranbartle family's pair of jewels.
<se_low>Dominico: They live in a very small place situated just below the fountain in the courtyard, as I told you before. Scatterbrain! Now get a move on!
<se_low>Dominico: I need you to get me the Kran Spinels. The Kranbartle family's pair of jewels.
<se_low>Dominico: They live in a very small place situated just below the fountain in the courtyard, as I already told you, <IF_MALE>Mr.<ELSE_NOT_MALE>Miss<ENDIF_MALE> Forgetful! Now get a move on!
<se_def>David: I owe Master Dominico my life.<page>David: About six months ago now, when I first arrived in Arcadia here, I was so weak that I collapsed. It was Master Dominico who helped me.
<se_def>David: He even offered to let me work here in his house as a servant. Words can't express how grateful I am.
<se_def>David: Sometimes he comes across as a bit cold, but he's a genuinely kind person inside.
<se_def>*: It's you! Aren't you...? Yes, we met in Alexandria. I'm sure of it. You remember me, don't you? Lorenzo, Jessica's fiancé.
<se_def>Lorenzo: I couldn't possibly return home without Jessica, so I have embarked on an impromptu journey.

<se_def>Lorenzo: I learn something new every day. People call me a sponge, you know.<page>Lorenzo: Because I soak up all the knowledge I come into contact with. Ah ha hah! At least, I think that's why they call me that...
<se_low>*: Oi, feather-brain! What are you sniggering about!? Hold the scaffolding still!
<se_def>Lorenzo: Er, yes! Of course! I'm so sorry!
<se_def>Lorenzo: I'm afraid I must get back to work. I've enrolled in an apprenticeship here, you know. We'll have to continue our little chat some other time.
<se_def>*: I thought masonry would be easy. I had no idea I would be worked this hard!<page>*: Do you realise I'm actually expected to STAND UP while I work!? It's inhuman!
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_low>*: The other day when I was gazing out to sea, I saw a ship go sailing by. It was just like the ones from the story books when I was a child.
<se_low>*: I've no idea who was on board, but I do hope they all arrived safely at their destination.
<se_def>*: Hiyaaaah-phew...
<se_high>*: Just look at all the stone my husband's bought!
<se_high>*: I keep telling him just to buy enough for what he needs at the time. I don't know! It makes the room feel tiny!
<se_high>*: Ah... Ah...
<se_low>*: Hm? What are you doing wandering about at this time of night? If it's a story you're after, come back in the morning!
<se_high>*: Aaaah-pheeew...
<se_def>*: That's it! Make yourself at home! Settle in and enjoy an evening of Arcadian culture!
<se_high>*: Hi! Come and relax! You owe yourself a bit of Me-Time! All brave heroes do!
<se_def>*: I don't know if it's true or not, but I heard a rumour that Prince Charmles of Argonia passed the royal initiation.
<se_def>*: It's not often you hear good things about the Prince. He's surprised everyone, I should think.
<se_high>*: This is the only piano in the whole town, so sometimes I ask if I can play it.
<se_high>*: There is a pipe organ in the church, but nothing compares to a good bit of boogie-woogie piano!

<se_low>*: I've only just taken on that lah-de-da choir boy as an apprentice, but I can see I won't be able to do nothing with him.<page>*: He calls himself Lorenzo, and he's about as much use as a blunt chisel!
<se_low>*: You look a good sight better than him! How d'ya feel about becoming an apprentice yourself?
<se_low>*: Wah ha ha hah! I wasn't serious! If I start taking any old Tom, Dick and Harry on, I'm not gonna have any gold left for booze, now am I!?
<se_high>*: I come from a very shabby town far off in the southeast.<page>*: I don't miss the place at all, but I do worry about my twin sister sometimes. She's still there, you see.
<se_high>*: She said she was gonna<endash> ...er, going to take up fortune-telling.<page>*: I hope she doesn't go off 'er rocker<endash> ...I mean, insane, with all the alaka-wams and hocus-pocus.
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! SSSH! AaaND WEeeLCOoooME TOoo MYSTEeeRY MAaRT!
<se_low>*: 2000 GOLD COINS FOooR ONEe. WEeeeeeLL?
<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU! KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH!
<se_low><Cap><leader> receives a seed of skill and puts it in the bag.
<se_low>*: OooH, NOo, NOooo! NOoT ENOUuuGH GOLD!? ...PITY.
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! SEeEee YOU AaGAIN...SOoMETIMEe!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! PITY...I'VEe SOoLD OoUuT. SEeEee YOU AaGAIN...SOoMETIMEe!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! SSSH! AaaND WEeeLCOoooME TOoo MYSTEeeRY MAaRT!
<se_low>*: 5000 GOLD COINS FOooR ONEe. WEeeeeeLL?

<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU! KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH!
NoOOOow I caNNNnn bUy thAAAat RinG aT lasSSSSt!
<se_low>*: OooH, NOo, NOooo! NOoT ENOUuuGH GOLD!? ...PITY.
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! SEeEee YOU AaGAIN...SOoMETIMEe!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! PITY...I'VEe SOoLD OoUuT. SEeEee YOU AaGAIN...SOoMETIMEe!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! I sAiD SSSH! BuT wEeeLCOoooME BAaCk TOoo mY SPAAaArKLy MYSTEeeRY MAaRT!

<se_low>*: SpEEeEciaAAL prICE TooOoday!
12,000 GOLD COINS FOooR ONEe.
WEeeeeeLL?
<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU! CooOOoME baACk sooOOONnn!
<se_low>*: OooH, NOo, NOooo! NOoT ENOUuuGH GOLD!? YoouUU aRRree poOreeeEER thAAan MeeeEE.

<se_low>*: KWA-kwAAa-haAA-hURGH-URGH!
NooOOOo wIndOW shOpPPpiing, pLeEEeaaASE!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! PITY...I'VEe SOoLD OoUuT. SEeEee YOU AaGAIN...SOoMETIMEe!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! SSSH! AaaND WEeeLCOoooME TOoo MYSTEeeRY MAaRT!

<se_low>*: SpEEeEciaAAL prICE TooOoday!
30,000 GOLD CoINS FOooR ONEe.
WEeeeeeLL?
<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU, TREassSSureED cuSTomeEEEr! AnD MOOooOre trEEeeasUReE foOOOr MEeeEEeee!
<se_low>*: OooH, NOo, NOooo! NOoT ENOUuuGH GOLD!? YoouUU aRRree poOreeeEER thAAan MeeeEE.

<se_low>*: KWA-kwAAa-haAA-hURGH-URGH!
NooOOOo wIndOW shOpPPpiing, pLeEEeaaASE!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! PITY...I'VEe SOoLD OoUuT. SEeEee YOU AaGAIN...SOoMETIMEe!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! HooOOw d'YOooU liiiKe mY suNDAaaY BEEeeeST? FUUuunDED frOOOm yooOUR poOocKET! MuUUCh obLIGeeEED!
<se_low>*: EEXtrAAAaaa SpEEeEciaAAL prICE TooOoday! 65,000 GOLD COINS FOooR ONEe. HooOOW aBOUuut iT?
<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU! CooOOoME baACk sooOOONnn!

<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! SSSH, remEMBERrr! WEeeLCOoooME TOoo
MYSTEeeRY MAaRT!
<se_low>*: EEXtrAAAaaa SpEEeEciaAAL prICE TooOoday! 100,000 GOLD COINS FOooR ONEe. HooOOW aBOUuut iT?
<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU! KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH, wooONdeeER whAT yoOUU'LL bUY neEEexT TiiiME...?
<se_low>*: OooH, NOo, NOooo! NOoT ENOUuuGH GOLD!? MuuuSSsT aAASk thAAt yoOOOU LEEeaAve thE esTAbliIIShmeEEent...
<se_low>*: SuuuUURe? OnNNn yoOUr heEAD beeEEE iT iiiff I SEeelL oOoOout.
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! PITY...I'VEe SOoLD OoUuT. WhoooOOOo knOWSs whEEN moOOorE stOCk isss COMiiInG...?

<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH! WEeeLCOoooME baACK TOoo 
MYSTEeeRY MAaRT! I'VE beEEN exPEecTIiinG yooOU...
<se_low>*: SpEEeEciaAAL prICE, jUSssT foR yooOU tODay! 100,000 GOLD COINS FOooR ONEe. YoooU knOW yOoU waNT IT!
<se_low>*: THAaaNK YOoUu, THAaNK YOooU! CooOOoME baACk sooOOONnn! AaaLWAysss WeLCOmeee...

<se_low>*: SsskINT!? TheERE's thE DOoooR.
SHow YOUrseEElf OUuuuT!
<se_low>*: SuuuUURe? ThisSs iS MY laAASt ooNEe FOr tooOODaAY...
<se_low>*: OUt, plEEEeASe! I'M clOOosING uP noOOow...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Hey! Stop it! He'll... He'll wake up...
<se_high>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_low>*: Huh? If you're lookin' for weapons, the shop's closed at night. Come back in the mornin'.
<se_low>*: AH-PHEW... AH-PHEW...
<se_high>*: Most of the stone statues in the world are made in Arcadia, you know.
<se_high>*: It makes you quite proud to live here, really. Although, it is a bit boring.
<se_def>Lorenzo: Ah-phoo... Ah-phoo...
<se_def>*: Ah-phoo... Ah-phoo...
<se_high>*: There's a rule here.<page>*: You aren't allowed to sell a statue to anyone from outside town if Dominico hasn't enchanted it and given it a soul using his magic powers.
<se_high>*: So everyone in town has to be nice to Dominico.
<se_high>*: But I know the truth. It was Dominico's own ancestors who invented that rule in the first place! It's so sneaky, don't you think?
<se_high>*: Mum and Dad are all posh when they speak with Mr. Dominico, but at home when he's not there they say really bad things about him.
<se_high>*: It's not fair! They always tell me off if I say anything bad about MY friends.
<se_def>*: Master Dominico has ordered the guard to be redoubled!
<se_def>*: I'm still hurting from where that girl hit me, but I'll be in trouble if I keep moaning about it.
<se_high>*: There are rooms in this mansion that even the staff aren't allowed to go inside.
<se_high>*: But I don't know where they are. I've been working here for more than two years now, and I've never come across them.
<se_def>*: I thought I'd lose my job because of that witch with the staff, but Master Dominico decided to keep me on because he thinks she might come back!<page>*: Ironic, isn't it?
<se_def>*: He'll give me my marching orders if I make another mistake, that's for sure.
<se_def>*: Master Dominico's talking about employing more people around the house. I hope there'll be some kitchen hands among the newcomers!
<se_low>Dominico: Ah, you're back! And without the Kran Spinels, judging by the expression on your <IF_SOLO>face<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>faces<ENDIF_SOLO>.
<se_low>Dominico: What's that? Old Rydon no longer has the jewels? I see...
<se_low>Dominico: And all we have to go on is the name of this ancestor of his, Alexandra...<page>Dominico: Hm, this is a problem. I can't construct the magical barrier without the Kran Spinels.
<se_low>Dominico: ...Ah-ha!
<se_low>Dominico: Prepare to be dazzled by my unbounded knowledge!<page>Dominico: My great brain informs me that somewhere in the world there is a village with almost the same name.
<se_low>Dominico: Perhaps this ancestor of Rydon is connected with the place in some way. That gives you a starting point for your investigations.
<se_low>Dominico: My great brain informs me that somewhere in the world there is a village with almost the same name as Rydon's ancestor, Alexandra.
<se_low>Dominico: Perhaps the two are connected in some way. You should start your investigations there.
<se_def>*: Apparently there's a famous magician here by the name of Dominico who's recruiting guards to protect his mansion.
<se_def>*: I heard the pay was pretty good, so I thought I may as well apply.
<se_high>*: My little boy's playing out in the street again today.
<se_high>*: I worry in case he's bitten by that great big dog of Dominico's. You know, Leopold.
<se_def>*: Ah, hello! So, did you manage to find my father?
<se_def>*: You did? And he didn't look like he'd be coming home any time soon? Ah ha ha! Yes, that'd be my dad! Same as ever!
<se_def>*: It's been his obsession for almost as long as I can remember to finish off that tower of his before he passes away.
<se_def>*: I might not be much of a stonemason myself, but I know enough to recognise that Dad's a real prodigy.
<se_def>*: And I know he feels the need to leave his mark on the world. I just wish he'd take better care of himself, that's all.
<se_high>*: My father-in-law used to sing the praises of our little girl all the time. He was always saying how quick on the uptake she was.
<se_high>*: It's the Kranbartle family genius showing through in her if you ask me.
<se_high>*: Dominico's in the garden making fun of David again. Poor David! He has to put up with it every single day.
<se_def>*: Looks like this man Dominico's got a taste for teasing his employees and making them suffer!
<se_def>*: He'll treat me like that if I do anything wrong. I can't afford any slip-ups!
<se_def>*: I thought I'd lose my job because of that witch with the staff, but Master Dominico decided to keep me on because he thinks she might come back!<page>*: Ironic, isn't it?
<se_def>*: He'll give me my marching orders if I make another mistake, that's for sure.
<se_def>*: The Master's taken on more guards with barely a moment's notice! I'm run off my feet trying to feed all these extra mouths!
<se_def>*: I only came here to buy some weapons. I never thought I'd end up getting a job!
<se_def>*: I'm looking forward to seeing this girl with the stick that everyone's talking about.<page>*: It'll give me a good opportunity to see how sharp my new blade is!
<se_def>*: There's one hell of a racket coming from upstairs. Has something happened at Dominico's place again?
<se_high>*: Dominico can be a bit nasty, but David's at fault too.
<se_high>*: I mean, he shouldn't put up with it! A real man would just pack up and leave!
<se_def>*: I saw the whole episode right from the start. The dog seemed to be in a foul mood. It was even barking at Dominico.
<se_def>*: Then David turned up with the thing's dinner, and Dominico just laid into him! It was completely unjustified! The man's got a screw loose, if you ask me!
<se_def>Leopold: Woof! Woof! Grrrrrrr.
<se_def>David: Oh, it's you! Ha ha ha! You saw that, did you? How embarrassing!
<se_def>David: For some reason the Master's in a bad mood today. He needs someone to take his frustration out on.
<se_def>David: I'll have to be careful he doesn't dismiss me. I don't want to leave this job. I like it here. And I'm very fond of the Master.
<se_def>David: I can't explain why exactly, but I feel like it's fate that I've ended up working here.
<se_low>Dominico: This leads to my secret library. You will find a book for me in there.
<se_low>Dominico: It's called ‘The Big Book of Barriers’. It contains a recipe for making a very powerful magical barrier.
<se_low>Dominico: What are you waiting for!? Didn't I tell you to stand guard outside the mansion and stall that wand-waving witch!?
<se_low>Dominico: Go! Now! Keep her busy while I finish constructing this barrier, and then I shall take care of her myself!
<se_low>Dominico: Hm? You're injured? You really are taking up far too much of my time! Fiery foo and bubbling goo... There!
<se_low>Dominico: Go! Now! Keep her busy while I finish constructing this barrier, and then I shall take care of her myself!
<se_high>*: I, I heard shouting from outside, and then the guards all went running out. What's going on!?
<se_high>*: No! Spare me! Please!
<se_high>*: That young witch sent all the guards flying! Just with a little flick of her stick, you know!
<se_high>*: She's using black magic, I tell you. Don't waste your time trying to stop her. I should just hand Dominico over to her, if I were you.
<se_def>*: Uuurgh... We couldn't do anything to stop her... Blast!
<se_low>*: You wouldn't have thought a woman'd be up to much, would you? But that one means business! She's gotta be some kind of demon!
<se_def>*: Th-There's nothing more we can do! Do you think this is it for the town!?
<se_def>*: You could sound a little more upset about it!
<se_def>*: Phew! Well, that's a relief!<page>*: ...Hang on a minute! What's there to be relieved about!? Just because you SAY the town'll be all right, it doesn't mean it WILL!
<se_high>*: I must say I was rather surprised. That girl can wield a fair amount of magic with that stick of 'ers<endash> ...hers.
<se_high>*: Without wishing to be rude, I'm fairly sure she'll have the upper hand over Dominico when it comes to magic.
<se_def>*: If Dominico gets killed, we'll have no one to enchant the statues with souls. Then what'll happen, eh!?

<se_high>*: I thought guards were supposed to be good at fighting! What a bunch of losers!
<se_def>*: Urrgh! No...
<se_def>*: All right! That's it! Yeah!
<se_def>*: It's all Dominico's fault! If he wasn't here, the town wouldn't have got in this mess in the first place!
<se_high>*: What are you doing just standing here talking!? Go and help David! Or are you a coward!?

<se_low>*: I don't know! The youth of today! If I were a couple of years younger, I could've got rid of that little girl with a stern word and a firm stare!<page>*: There's only one of her, for crying out loud!
<se_high>*: Oh! I don't believe it! I wanted a front-row view of the action when that woman came back for a fight. I'd been waiting ages!
<se_high>*: I only nipped off to get a bite to eat. I wasn't gone for more than a few minutes. But she came just when I wasn't there to see!
<se_high>*: That's the second time we've had to weather such a storm.
<se_high>*: Dear Goddess, have you abandoned the good people of Arcadia?
<se_low>*: Blast it all! I'm too late! I can't see! I can't see a thing from here!
<se_low>*: KWA-HUURGH-URGH-URGH!
<se_low>*: I suppose this marks the end of the peace we've enjoyed here for so long. How sad.
<se_high>*: Even at times like these, the weapon and armour shops are still doing business!

<se_high>*: Then he'll see to it that you're in good health. He'll heal you.

<se_def>Lorenzo: Ah-ha! This is it! At last! Now the Master's not here, this is my chance!
<se_low>*: I can't get a very good view, but I think there's a woman perched on top of that hideous statue outside Dominico's mansion.
<se_low>*: And she looks like a bit of a cracker! Oh, I'm forgetting myself! This is no time for that kind of chat!
<se_def>*: I've got a deadline to meet with this statue! I wish they'd keep the noise down outside!
<se_high>*: Why am I stuck in here!? Everyone else is having fun outside! I can hear them!<page>*: Mum and Dad said I had to stay at home while they were out. It's not fair!
<se_def>*: Listen to all the noise upstairs! Sounds like that troublemaker's back again.
<se_def>*: But there'll be no trouble here! I won't let anyone hurt my family!
<se_high>*: Mum! What's going to happen to us!?
<se_high>*: There's no need to worry, dear. We Kranbartles are special. Our ancestors will protect us.
<se_high>*: So you just relax and go to sleep now.

<se_def>*: Blast! I can't...

<se_def>David: Thank the Goddess you're back again!
<se_def>David: I've just about managed to hold her off so far, but I can't keep this up on my own!

<se_high>*: I saw Dominico fighting that witch with my own eyes. Whatever you say about the man, he's certainly a very powerful magician.
<se_high>*: I know he's got his faults in other areas, but you can't help being impressed by his magic.
<se_low>*: Is that...thing, a friend of yours? It looks like a monster to me! I'm sorry, but I'll have to ask you to stay away from my inn!

<se_def>*: Sir Leopoooold! Where aaaare you!?
<se_def>*: The man's a real slave-driver! My wounds haven't healed properly yet, but he's still ordering me to go and look for his stupid dog!
<se_def>*: I just want to find it, get my pay, and go back to working at the checkpoint as soon as possible!
<se_low>*: That good-for-nothing apprentice of mine has done a runner!<page>*: He must have slipped off in all the excitement. What a lazy bleeding clothes-horse!
<se_high>*: Y-You've got to help David!
<se_high>*: I've been waiting here for ages since the last fight I missed.
<se_high>*: But that kind of thing doesn't exactly happen all the time, does it? I can't believe I missed the action before!
<se_high>*: Dad said the lady who attacked Dominico was really beautiful.
<se_high>*: I wish I'd seen her!
<se_high>*: Master Dominico's become thoroughly depressed since Leopold ran away.
<se_high>*: It must have been a terrible shock for him.
<se_high>*: If you're looking for him, he'll be dining about now, I should think.
<se_def>David: There you are!
<se_def>David: Thank you so much! I'll never forget how you saved my life.
<se_def>David: I just can't work out why she went for me, though. It doesn't make any sense.
<se_def>David: She said I was an heir of a great sage, but she's got it wrong. I'm just an ordinary man.
<se_def>David: I'm nothing more than a servant. Master Dominico is the noble one. And I'll always serve him to the very best of my ability.
<se_def>David: Anyway, there's no time to stand around chatting! I've got to go and look for Sir Leopold.
<se_def>David: I wonder where he went. He can be a bit scary, but he's a very intelligent animal.
<se_def>David: Let me know if you spot him anywhere.
<se_def>David: I'm always making a mess of things, so this time I really want to help the Master. I owe it to him to do everything I can to find Sir Leopold.
<se_def>*: I was beaten twice by the same girl, so now I've been put on dog-hunting duty! Hardly surprising. My days as a guard are over!
<se_def>*: When that girl brandished that stick she had, it was as if my whole body had been drained of energy.
<se_def>*: There was no way I could have defeated her with a sword alone. No, I've learnt a valuable lesson!
<se_def>*: There's been all kinds of trouble here in town lately. It's a shame. The place used to be nice and quiet before.
<se_low>*: That woman who was here brandishing her wand had a fine figure on her! You must have noticed. I mean, you could hardly miss it!
<se_low>*: Seeing her has given me one or two ideas. A real gush of inspiration! I feel something special coming on, I do!
<se_def>*: Dominico is usually very cold with people, but he was surprisingly friendly to you.
<se_def>*: What? You didn't think so? Oh, that's just because you don't know what he's usually like!
<se_def>*: Under normal circumstances, he'd never have let that witch go, you know.
<se_high>*: Well, we've seen it all here recently, haven't we!? But thank the Goddess no one lost their life.
<se_def>*: Leopold normally stands behind Dominico and barks his head off at people. But he wasn't so bold when that witch turned up, was he!?
<se_def>*: And now he's run off somewhere. He must've been terrified! Serves the pesky mutt right!
<se_def>*: After all that commotion, everything turned out all right in the end. Thank goodness for that!
<se_def>*: And I don't suppose Dad knows anything about it!
<se_high>*: Everyone who knows anything about masonry says the same thing:
<se_high>*: Rydon Kranbartle is a man of unparalleled genius. He's already outstripped all of the great Kranbartles who've gone before him.
<se_high>*: But my poor father-in-law just can't see it! I suppose that's the trouble with geniuses. Sometimes the simplest things pass them by.
<se_high>*: I LOVE Grandad's statue! It's so BOING, and really BOOM! And kind of BAM as well!
<se_def>*: In all the commotion, everyone just left without paying for their drinks!
<se_def>*: I'm properly in the red now! I lost a fortune! Dear oh dear...
<se_high>*: Masonry is the art of creating the Goddess's image in rock. All the people of Arcadia are Her obedient servants.
<se_high>*: Not a single life was lost in either of the disturbances we've had of late.<page>*: More proof, if any were needed, that the town is under the Goddess's divine protection.
<se_high>*: Normally the Master eats enough for three, but he's not had a single bite today.
<se_high>*: And he doesn't look very well for it. I think fighting off that woman before really took it out of him.
<se_def>*: Listen to what I heard today! There's talk that Master Dominico isn't the heir of the great sage at all. They're saying it's actually David!
<se_def>*: I ask you! What a load of rubbish! Don't you go believing it! I really don't know who starts all this gossip sometimes!
<se_high>*: The thunder was so loud, I couldn't hear very well...
<se_high>*: But I think that witch said Dominico wasn't the heir of the great sage he's always on about, and that it was really David!
<se_high>*: If you ask me, neither of them look like anything special. But I'm starting to wonder if any of this great sage stuff is true.
<se_def>*: I hear that dog of Dominico's has run off.
<se_def>*: You should be careful, or you might end up being bitten like I was.
<se_high>*: Apparently the apprentice in the workshop just above us here ran off because the work was too hard!

<se_low>Dominico: But the Great Dominico does not suffer from indecision and regret!
<se_low>Dominico: ...I'm in no mood to talk now. Leave me! Come back and see me later if you need something.

<se_def>*: It's not easy saying goodbye to someone you've worked with.
<se_high>*: Master Dominico seems to have got his health back, but he's still very gloomy.
<se_high>*: I suppose it's no surprise, what with everything that's happened.
<se_def>*: I was more than a little surprised, I don't mind telling you! David WAS the real heir of the great sage, not Master Dominico at all!

<se_def>*: Ahhh! She's back!

<se_def>*: Even so, the sight of your face is enough to start me shaking now. I can't help it.
<se_def>*: I made such a mess of everything before, I was sure I was going to get the sack.
<se_def>*: But Master Dominico must have mellowed a bit.

<se_high>*: He suddenly jumped down from the roof and stabbed a wooden stick into David's back.
<se_high>*: I came to see David every day...but I never thought I'd be there to see his last moments... It's just too sad...
<se_low>*: It's terribly sad to see someone younger than yourself pass away.
<se_def>*: Dominico paid me a great wage.
<se_def>*: He might not be the friendliest man around, but at least he's generous! He's all right by me!
<se_high>*: David was quite popular among the young women in town, you know.
<se_high>*: He was handsome and loyal. Two things that make a man very attractive to a young lady!
<se_def>*: If you head north out of Arcadia, and keep going on and on, long past old Rydon's tower, you'll come to a short tunnel.
<se_def>*: Most of the people here don't go there much, mind. It's mighty cold on the other side, see.
<se_def>*: A letter just arrived from Dad. By carrier pigeon!
<se_def>*: Apparently he's coming home soon. That's almost unheard of, I can tell you. I wonder what's happened.
<se_def>*: Maybe it's something to do with being perched up here together on this stone arch, but there's a real family atmosphere in Arcadia.
<se_def>*: So you can understand why everyone's taking the loss of poor David so much to heart.
<se_high>*: I can't believe David's gone! ...I'll let you in on a little secret. I really liked David. I never told him, though.
<se_high>*: Masonry is the art of creating the Goddess's image in rock. All the people of Arcadia are Her obedient servants.
<se_high>*: And as such, the Goddess sends things to try us. We must have faith, and we will overcome these hardships.
<se_high>*: People say the medicinal herbs they sell in Orkutsk up north really work. Apparently, it's because they're grown in such a cold climate.
<se_high>*: I'd like to sell them here too, but it's such a long way to Orkutsk.
<se_def>*: I knew it! That Leopold is a savage beast! What kind of dog would kill the very person who looks after it!?
<se_def>*: It bit me once, you know. Looking back now, I suppose I got off lightly!
<se_low>*: I just exchanged a few words with Dominico for the first time in a while.<page>*: I don't know if it's because he's so low at the moment, but it looked like he'd aged ten years or more.
<se_low>*: Mind you, if being down makes him a bit more laid-back, things would certainly be easier for everyone 'round here.
<se_low>*: Someone told me once about these people who live in a secluded place in the mountains, completely cut off from the rest of the world.
<se_low>*: It sounds like the kind of place where wizards would live, don't you think?
<se_def>*: Ahhh! She's back!
<se_def>*: ...Oh, no. That's right. We don't have to worry about you attacking us any more, do we?
<se_def>*: Even so, the sight of your face is enough to start me shaking now. I can't help it.
<se_def>*: Oh, it's you! Thanks for your help protecting Master Dominico.
<se_def>*: It's been pretty peaceful around here since then. It's in danger of getting a bit boring actually!
<se_low>*: I've been looking out to sea like this ever since I was a young girl.
<se_low>*: Far, far across the ocean, there's a small island where a man I know lives. It was a long time ago now, but we were in love once, you see.
<se_def>*: Even if I went back to the checkpoint, there probably wouldn't be any work. So I've decided to stay here and work for Dominico.
<se_def>*: With my salary I could drink as much as I wanted every day and still have some left over. Yup, this place suits me down to the ground!
<se_low>*: Lorenzo ran off while everyone was distracted with that witch. That apprentice was the biggest waste of space I've ever seen!
<se_def>*: There hasn't been any kind of disturbance here for a while now. The town's back to its peaceful ways. Just right for masonry work.
<se_def>*: I hear old Rydon's coming back to town. How many years has it been, I wonder? I'll have to go and have a chat with him.
<se_high>*: Grandpa Rydon invited me to his house!
<se_high>*: It's the best! There's nothing like home cooking! (Slurp!)
<se_def>*: My father was so strict with me when I was a lad, but he's all sweetness and light with his granddaughter!
<se_def>*: I just don't understand him.
<se_high>*: Wahey! Grandpa's back! Grandpa's back!
<se_low>Rydon: Ah, you're <IF_SOLO>one of the ones<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>the ones<ENDIF_SOLO> who climbed my tower, aren't you?
<se_low>Rydon: I still want to build it higher, but there's a problem. That's why I've come back here, you see.
<se_low>Rydon: It's my granddaughter. She's just too adorable. It's interrupting my work.
<se_high>*: There's an old legend in the Kranbartle family. One of our ancestors, Alexander, sculpted the statue of the Goddess on the Holy Isle of Neos.
<se_high>*: And do you know what!? They say that he was actually looking at the Goddess with his own eyes as he carved the stone.
<se_high>*: Apparently, the Goddess inspired courage in everyone She met. And they say She could fly, too! I'd love to know more about Her.
<se_high>*: We hardly see Dominico at all since that scary woman attacked the town.
<se_high>*: He must be getting even fatter, being stuck inside every day. I hope he hasn't got wedged in a doorway or something!
<se_def>*: This is Master Dominico's residence. Unless you've got some business here, I must ask you to<endash> Oh! It's you!
<se_def>*: The Master's upstairs. You should go and tell him you're here.
<se_low>Dominico: Ah, good! You're back. Have you...disposed of Leopold for me?
<se_low>Dominico: You chased him up north but then he flew away, you say!?
<se_low>Dominico: I've never heard of a flying dog before!
<se_low>Dominico: ...Nevertheless, you do appear to be telling the truth. I suppose there's nothing you could have done.
<se_low>Dominico: But my feelings haven't changed! Leopold must be destroyed! I know I can rely on you.
<se_low>Dominico: Ah, yes. There's something I've been meaning to tell you.
<se_low>Dominico: When David first arrived here, he told me something about the place he'd been before.
<se_low>Dominico: It seems he'd been living in an isolated valley somewhere.
<se_low>Dominico: I don't know the actual location, but he did say something about a place where all manner of beings lived together in harmony.
<se_low>Dominico: I doubt that such information will be any use to you on its own, but I thought it was only right to tell you, for David's sake.
<se_low>Dominico: Anyway, good luck finding Leopold.
<se_low>*: I heard that the Baccarat casino was closed down for a while. I wonder if it's open again now.
<se_low>*: If I could spare a few days, I was thinking I might go and see what's what.
<se_low>*: We're blessed with a bench in town that has a wonderful view across the ocean. It's been a second home to me over the years.
<se_low>*: Yes, the man I love is out there somewhere, on a little island far, far across the sea.
<se_high>*: It must be more than six months now since David came to the house.
<se_high>*: My first impressions were of a grubby little traveller, but he's actually very attentive and good-natured. He's a nice lad, you know.
<se_high>*: I really can't see why Dominico has such a problem with him. And why on earth would you employ someone you dislike so much anyway!?
<se_def>*: Some stonemasons toss their failed works into the ocean, but I like to keep mine.
<se_def>*: I find it helps me to improve what I'm doing if I have some failures to look at while I'm working.<page>*: I suppose it's rather like a warning not to make the same mistake twice.
<se_high>*: The Kranbartle family is full of talented masons. Unfortunately, my husband isn't one of them!
<se_high>*: It upset him quite a lot when he was younger, but he's got over it now and manages to enjoy the other things in his life.
<se_def>*: Nobody breaks through the checkpoint while I'm on duty!<page>*: I'll teach that girl a lesson! Although...I seem to have lost her for the time being.
<se_def>*: But I can't go back now. It'd be too annoying, having come all this way. I may as well have a look at the sights while I'm here.
<se_low>*: I was given instructions by a certain wealthy gentleman to come here and purchase a statue of a woman on his behalf.
<se_low>*: But there are so many workshops in this place, I don't know where to start!
<se_low>*: That good-for-nothing apprentice of mine has done a runner!<page>*: He must have slipped off in all the excitement. What a lazy bleeding clothes-horse!
<se_high>*: My father-in-law used to sing the praises of our little girl all the time. He was always saying how quick on the uptake she was.
<se_high>*: It's the Kranbartle family genius showing through in her if you ask me.
<se_def>*: Apparently there's a famous magician here by the name of Dominico who's recruiting guards to protect his mansion.
<se_def>*: I heard the pay was pretty good, so I thought I may as well apply.
<se_high>*: Well, we've seen it all here recently, haven't we!? But thank the Goddess no one lost their life.
<se_def>*: In all the commotion, everyone just left without paying for their drinks!
<se_def>*: I'm properly in the red now! I lost a fortune! Dear oh dear...
<se_def>*: Dominico is usually very cold with people, but he was surprisingly friendly to you.
<se_def>*: What? You didn't think so? Oh, that's just because you don't know what he's usually like!
<se_def>*: Under normal circumstances, he'd never have let that witch go, you know.
<se_high>*: Everyone who knows anything about masonry says the same thing:
<se_high>*: Rydon Kranbartle is a man of unparalleled genius. He's already outstripped all of the great Kranbartles who've gone before him.
<se_high>*: But my poor father-in-law just can't see it! I suppose that's the trouble with geniuses. Sometimes the simplest things pass them by.
<se_high>*: David was quite popular among the young women in town, you know.
<se_high>*: He was handsome and loyal. Two things that make a man very attractive to a young lady!
<se_def>*: Maybe it's something to do with being perched up here together on this stone arch, but there's a real family atmosphere in Arcadia.
<se_def>*: So you can understand why everyone's taking the loss of poor David so much to heart.
<se_high>*: David's loyalty to his master was very touching. He was the most faithful man I've ever met.
<se_high>*: There's an old legend in the Kranbartle family. One of our ancestors, Alexander, sculpted the statue of the Goddess on the Holy Isle of Neos.
<se_high>*: And do you know what!? They say that he was actually looking at the Goddess with his own eyes as he carved the stone.
<se_high>*: Apparently, the Goddess inspired courage in everyone She met. And they say She could fly, too! I'd love to know more about Her.
<se_low>*: Lorenzo ran off while everyone was distracted with that witch. That apprentice was the biggest waste of space I've ever seen!
<se_high>Jessica: Back again, are we!? How pathetically misguided you are!
<se_high>Jessica: Fine. This time I'll make sure you can never get in my way again!
<se_low>Dominico: Ah, you're back at last, <leader>! I've been waiting for you.
<se_low>Dominico: ...I presume that expression on your face means you have finally defeated Leopold?
<se_low>Dominico: Don't worry, I'm not going to get upset with you! The dog you destroyed was no longer the same creature as my wonderful Leopold.
<se_low>Dominico: It's over, then. I can finally grieve for my lost friends.
<se_low>Dominico: I'm sorry for having caused you so much trouble.
<se_low>Dominico: Now I've decided to turn over a new leaf.
<se_low>Dominico: One of my servants told me it was David's wish that the townspeople and I could live together happily.
<se_low>Dominico: So I've made up my mind to smooth things over a little. To see if I can't make David's wish come true.

<se_low>Dominico: I suppose <IF_SOLO>you'll<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>you and your friends will<ENDIF_SOLO> be continuing with your travels, will you, <leader>? I hope you'll come and visit Arcadia again some time.
<se_def>*: Oh, it's <IF_SOLO>you<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>you lot<ENDIF_SOLO>. If you're looking for Master Dominico, he's inside.
<se_def>*: Ever since the sky turned red the other day, he's been in there frantically looking things up in his books.
<se_def>*: Ahhh! She's back!
<se_def>*: ...Oh, no. That's right. We don't have to worry about you attacking us any more, do we?
<se_def>*: Even so, the sight of your face is enough to start me shaking now. I can't help it.
<se_high>*: I saw that huge rock flying in the sky.
<se_high>*: I wonder if Dominico knows anything about it.
<se_low>*: I dunno, first a witch attacks the town, and now the sky's turned red! You never know what's gonna happen next, do ya!?
<se_def>*: We had a bit of peace and quiet for a while, but now there's another calamity!<page>*: I'm going to have to find somewhere quieter or I'll never get any work done.
<se_low>*: Seeing that rather fine-looking woman before gave me inspiration all right! But I don't know...
<se_low>*: Somehow I just don't seem to be able to make a decent statue. I haven't got the talent of a gifted stonemason.
<se_def>*: People are sayin' the monsters outside town have got tougher. Ya can't even go out for a walk these days!
<se_def>*: People are talking about nothing but the sky turning red. What's the big deal, eh?
<se_def>*: I mean, when I was a lad, a red sky at night was someone-or-other's delight.
<se_high>*: I had a dream about the sister I left behind in Pickham.
<se_high>*: She was gibbering on about something or other. I hope she's all right.
<se_low>Dominico: Ah, so I was right! I thought you'd be paying me visit.
<se_low>Dominico: I can feel it. A terrible evil, worse than the one I felt before the sky turned red.
<se_low>Dominico: Sealing that evil away is an impossibility now! Destroying it is the only option!
<se_low>Dominico: Good luck, <leader>! The duty once fulfilled by the great sages now rests on your shoulders!
<se_low>Dominico: Good luck, <leader>! The duty once fulfilled by the great sages now rests on your shoulders!
<se_high>*: Some people are saying that the sky turning red is an omen signalling the end of the world.
<se_high>*: It's not that I don't believe it, it's just that I don't really know how to react to news like that!
<se_def>*: Apparently the Goddess statue on the Holy Isle of Neos has been destroyed.
<se_def>*: It saddens me to think I'll never see that beautiful work of art again.
<se_high>*: I've lived in Arcadia all my life. I used to play with Dominico when we were children, you know.
<se_high>*: Looking back now, I sometimes wonder if all our teasing hasn't had something to do with the way he's turned out.
<se_low>*: Have you heard? They say the Baccarat casino's open again now.
<se_low>*: I think I might go and try my luck if I can spare the time.
<se_low>*: Things aren't good. Ever since the sky went red, no one's been comin' to town.
<se_low>*: People say it's the end of the world. Maybe they're right!
<se_low>*: Someone told me once about these people who live in a secluded place in the mountains, completely cut off from the rest of the world.
<se_low>*: It sounds like the kind of place where wizards would live, don't you think?
<se_high>*: I love reading horoscopes. There was something about a red sky in one I read the other day.
<se_high>*: It said that if the sky turns red, you can expect to be lucky in love three days later! The best chance of your life, it said!
<se_high>*: Someone help! Come quickly! I-It's David!
<se_high>*: W-What was that!? I heard screaming! What's happened!?
<se_def>*: Heaven forbid! Not more trouble!
<se_low>Dominico: Ooooh! My head! And I'm shaking all over. What's wrong with me?
<se_low>Dominico: Ooooh!
<voice_0x01001273><se_high>*: P-Please! You must help David!
<se_low>Yangus: The sceptre went missin' about the time that Dominico bloke was up to 'is tricks.
<se_low>Yangus: Cor, we'll be in a right fix if it's fallen into the sea or somefin'!
<se_def>Angelo: I realise we had no choice, but fighting a lady goes against everything I believe in.
<se_def>Angelo: Then again, I've never had a thing for aggressive women.
<se_low>Dominico: Ah, you're back! ...And without the Kran Spinels judging by the expression on your <IF_SOLO>face<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>faces<ENDIF_SOLO>.
<se_low>Dominico: There's no time for this! We don't know when that vexing witch is going to show herself again.
<se_low>Dominico: Now I'll tell you again in case you've forgotten. The Kranbartle household is just below the fountain in the courtyard. So be off with you!
